bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 165, Number 7 (Monday, January 14, 2019)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. YOUNG:H.R. 544.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article 1, Section 8The Constitutional authority of Congress to enact thislegislation is provided by Article I, Section 8 of the UnitedStates Constitution (clause 18), which grants Congress thepower to make all Laws which shall be necessary and properfor carrying into Execution the foregoing powers.[Page H544]

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Reform.

item.name: Government employee pay, benefits, personnel management

summary.text:
Continuing Federal Employee Leave Policy Act of 2019

This bill requires federal employees to accrue annual and sick leave during a lapse in appropriations.

bill.title: Continuing Federal Employee Leave Policy Act of 2019

item.title: Continuing Federal Employee Leave Policy Act of 2019
To amend title 5, United States Code, to provide accrual of annual and sick leave for Federal employees of an agency subject to a lapse in appropriations, and for other purposes.
Continuing Federal Employee Leave Policy Act of 2019

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Reform.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
